TopicTitle: How many hours have you played?

Articles.Content:
I'm on 235 hours of success and failure alike, mostly spent flying spaceplanes and mad designs.

Come flex your personal gameplay hours and what you've been doing the most.

Most hours player wins a cookie.
According to Steam, 274 hours, but I've been around well before the Steam version came, so I'm guessing about 500 hours or more.
only 117 hours here ... noob pilot
Steam reports 180, but this is inaccurate, because I've been playing since quite a while before Steam transfers were availible.
I've honestly lost count. Considering I've been playing since early December 2012, I'd have to venture a guess of too damned many.
Only really started playing seriously when I transferred to Steam, so 260+ hours at last count
727... maybe I should take a break....
249 and i havent even got a kerbal to another planet and back
Somewhere in the thousands, probably. I have too much free time...
Somewhere around 300-350 hours
Thousands, easily. Unemployment leads to boredom, boredom leads to KSP, KSP leads to explosions...
700 or so...too many to be accurate.

700 odd mostly spent building things which never worked,I don't sleep much:P

Edited August 13, 2013 by Spartwo
Steam says 110, but I've played since Januaray, so probably 200 hours, which really isn't a lot .

You should try the retirement / KSP combo. I highly recommend it. That leads to over 735 hours of pure KSP goodness! I stay out of my wife's hair, get the occasional "to-do" list out of the way, and have loads of fun digesting all the math and science oozing out of every pour of this game. Add in the hours of checking out all the great tutorials, the forums, youtube channels, reddits, steam forums, and you have a certifiable problem trying to fit all that into any schedule much less a retired one!
Remember to include what the majority of hours was spent doing guys!

probably more than 1000 considering i bought the game over a year ago now.

I have been spending it building airplanes, and rockets and doing the things shown in my signature.
After 2 years, I really don't want to know...

130 hours according to Steam.

Most of it building crazy contraptions, not so much flying them.

Remember to include what the majority of hours was spent doing guys!

Kerbin system operations, mostly--interplanetary stuff is hard. However, I DO have a strong urge to go to Jool...

98.

And I started in .20.

I feel really alone on these forums sometimes. ;n;

According to Steam, 279 hours (plus about 15 more minutes spent on the demo before realizing I had to buy this game). And that's just from May 2013, when I first head about KSP. I also hold down a full time job if you can believe that.

I'm also new to the forums, I just registered Sunday. This is my second post!

I've spent my KSP time doing many things, but most of it leads back to trying to build complicated missions and making them succeed. I will leave you with a gallery of my first colony since upgrading to 0.21.1. (It's also my first Minmus colony, having done the Mun and Duna in the past) I shared this in the "What did you do today" thread, but it seems appropriate here too.

Some mission statistics

Part estimation: ~2,000 (the lag was terrible)

Number of Crafts: 15

Approximate total hours spent: 30

Craft List

2 X hover craft

2 X small refinery pods

1 rover

1 habitat (with 4 escape pods)

1 large refinery hub

2 X interplanetary engines

1 satellite

1 skycrane

EDIT: The gallery link isn't working for some reason. You can click on the album and view it here http://stevop80.imgur.com/

Edited August 13, 2013 by StevoP80
Image Gallery
I'm not sure, but I started in 0.8 or 0.9, so probably more than a thousand .

I don't even want to know how many hours I have put into this game, but since I started at 0.16 about I would say at least 500 hours. After all that time I still haven't sent a kerbal to another planet just probes and rovers.

Edited August 13, 2013 by Tophir
98 hours, and I've only been playing since .20
